pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.16.1: I translate in accordance with the findings of Oskar von Hinüber and Bhikkhu Anālayo in their paper “The Robes of a Bhikkhunī”.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.2: SP.4.1227: Acchinnacīvarikāyātiādīsu saṅkaccikacīvarameva cīvaranti veditabbaṃ, “Her robe is stolen, etc.: just the robe which is the chest cover is to be understood.” The “etc”, ādisu, refers to the following non-offense, “If her robe is lost”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.12.0: At this point the Pali reads Dhammikavagga to indicate the last chapter of pācittiya rules for the nuns. This indication is redundant in the present translation, since I have pointed out all the missing rules, including direct references to their counterparts in the chapter on pācittiya rules for the bhikkhus.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.13.0: At this point the Pali reads Nandasikkhāpada to indicate the last rule in the chapter of pācittiya rules for the nuns. This indication is redundant in the present translation, since I have pointed out all the missing rules, including direct references to their counterparts in the chapter on pācittiya rules for the bhikkhus.
